Award.AbstractNarration: Abstract<br/><br/>Award: DMS-0852734<br/>Principal Investigator: James A. Isenberg, Boris I. Botvinnik<br/><br/>This award provides partial support for meetings of the Pacific<br/>Northwest Geometry Seminar (PNGS) to be held during 2009--2012 at<br/>the University of British Columbia, Oregon State University,<br/>University of Oregon, University of Utah, University of<br/>Washington, Portland State University, and Stanford<br/>University. Invited research talks by leading experts in<br/>differential geometry and algebraic geometry are complemented by<br/>discussion sessions in which the speakers and participants assess<br/>the state of various areas in geometry, and highlight open<br/>problems in these areas.<br/><br/>There are a number of very active researchers in geometry<br/>scattered throughout the various universities which are involved<br/>in the Pacific Northwest Geometry Seminar. These periodic<br/>meetings bring these researchers together for consultation,<br/>collaboration, and stimulation of new ideas. A significant number<br/>of research programs have been initiated as a result of<br/>interactions at these meetings. The PNGS is especially valuable<br/>for graduate students in geometry at the various participating<br/>universities which have small geometry groups. The PNGS meetings<br/>give these students an excellent opportunity to see the broader<br/>picture of research in geometry. The meetings are also very<br/>valuable for the growing number of geometers working at some of<br/>the smaller universities in the region, such as Pacific<br/>University, Lewis and Clark, Seattle University, and Idaho<br/>State. More information can be found on the conference website<br/>located at www.math.washington.edu/~lee/PNGS<br/>
